column4: User Query (English)
column5: Chatbot Response (English)

column4: I lost my luggage after arrival. Where should I report it?
column5: Please visit the Lost & Found desk located near Baggage Belt 3 at Islamabad Airport.

column4: Who should I contact if my baggage didn’t arrive?
column5: Contact the Lost & Found counter beside the customs exit area.

column4: Is there a Lost & Found section at the airport?
column5: Yes, it’s located in the Arrival Hall near the information counter.

column4: What are the Lost & Found office hours?
column5: The office operates 24/7 at Islamabad International Airport.

column4: I left my passport on the plane. What should I do?
column5: Report immediately to your airline counter or the Lost & Found office.

column4: How can I file a lost baggage complaint?
column5: You can file a complaint at the Lost & Found counter or call +92-51-111-786-787.

column4: My suitcase is damaged. Who handles it?
column5: File a report at your airline’s baggage claim counter in the arrival area.

column4: I lost my wallet near immigration. Can someone help?
column5: Yes, contact the airport security or Lost & Found section right away.

column4: Where can I collect my recovered items?
column5: Recovered items can be collected from the Lost & Found office with valid ID proof.

column4: I forgot my phone in the washroom. What should I do?
column5: Visit the Lost & Found desk and provide details; staff will help you locate it.

column4: How long does it take to recover lost baggage?
column5: Usually within 24–48 hours, depending on airline tracking.

column4: Is there a helpline for missing items?
column5: Yes, call the Islamabad Airport helpline at +92-51-111-786-787.

column4: Can I check the status of my lost item online?
column5: Currently, only in-person or phone inquiries are available.

column4: My Airblue bag didn’t arrive. Where should I go?
column5: Visit Airblue’s arrival counter or the Lost & Found desk near Belt 4.

column4: What documents do I need to collect a lost item?
column5: Bring your CNIC/passport and proof of item ownership.

column4: I lost my boarding pass. Can I still claim my bag?
column5: Yes, show your ID and flight details at the Lost & Found office.

column4: I think someone took my bag by mistake. What now?
column5: Report immediately to Lost & Found; they’ll check CCTV footage.

column4: Is there CCTV in the baggage claim area?
column5: Yes, the entire baggage hall is covered with CCTV cameras.

column4: My bag was delayed. Will it be delivered to my home?
column5: Some airlines offer delivery; check with your airline representative.

column4: I lost a gold chain. How do I report it?
column5: File a detailed report at the Lost & Found section near customs.

column4: I found someone’s bag on the trolley. What should I do?
column5: Hand it over to the nearest security officer or Lost & Found desk.

column4: Can I email about my lost item?
column5: Yes, email details to lostfound@islamabadairport.com.

column4: Where is the Lost & Found office located exactly?
column5: It’s beside the international arrivals exit, near Belt 2.

column4: I lost my CNIC inside the terminal.
column5: Please report at the information counter; they’ll guide you to Lost & Found.

column4: My flight arrived yesterday; can I still claim my lost bag today?
column5: Yes, unclaimed items are stored safely for up to 30 days.

column4: What happens if no one claims an item?
column5: After 90 days, unclaimed items are handed to airport authorities.

column4: My baggage tag is missing. Can I still track my bag?
column5: Yes, provide your flight and bag details to the airline staff.

column4: Can someone else collect my lost item on my behalf?
column5: Yes, with an authorization letter and copy of your CNIC.

column4: I lost my laptop charger. How can I check if it’s found?
column5: Ask at the Lost & Found counter with your arrival date and flight number.

column4: Is there a separate Lost & Found for domestic flights?
column5: Yes, near the domestic arrivals area, beside Belt 1.

column4: I lost my baby stroller. Where do I go?
column5: Lost strollers are kept at the baggage claim help desk.

column4: Can I track my lost item by phone number?
column5: No, you need your item’s description and flight details.

column4: I lost my glasses. Can someone help?
column5: Yes, Lost & Found maintains a list of found accessories; please check there.

column4: What if I lost my mobile charger?
column5: Visit Lost & Found and describe your charger; they’ll verify and return it.

column4: I found someone’s passport. What should I do?
column5: Hand it immediately to immigration or the Lost & Found office.

column4: Can I check CCTV footage myself?
column5: No, only authorized staff can review footage after a written request.

column4: I lost my bag trolley token. Do I need to pay again?
column5: Yes, a new token costs Rs. 100 at the trolley counter.

column4: Who is in charge of the Lost & Found section?
column5: It’s managed by the Airport Facilitation Department.

column4: My baggage was opened. Who do I report this to?
column5: Report it to the airline baggage supervisor immediately.

column4: I forgot my earphones in the waiting area.
column5: Check with Lost & Found; staff collect all items from seating zones daily.

column4: Is there a WhatsApp number for Lost & Found?
column5: No official WhatsApp yet; please call the helpline.

column4: Can I claim someone else’s item if it looks like mine?
column5: No, you must provide proof of ownership.

column4: How long are lost items kept?
column5: Lost items are stored up to 90 days before disposal.

column4: My bag arrived damaged. Will the airport compensate me?
column5: Compensation depends on your airline’s baggage policy.

column4: What is the average claim processing time?
column5: Around 15–30 minutes, depending on verification.

column4: Can I get updates about my lost item via SMS?
column5: Currently, SMS tracking is not available.

column4: I left my jacket near the arrival gate.
column5: Visit Lost & Found with flight details; they’ll help locate it.

column4: What if I lost a valuable item like jewelry?
column5: Inform Lost & Found and file a high-value report immediately.

column4: Can I recover something I lost last week?
column5: Yes, visit the office with your flight details and description.

column4: Is there any charge for using Lost & Found services?
column5: No, the service is completely free for passengers.
